pullrequest.title: Add a new semi-supervised test case

content.raw:
I'd seriously consider changing the "simplesemi" folder name to "simplesemisupervised". It makes everything much clearer at a glace what it's testing (though the current name isn't all that bad).

Also how did you select your semi-supervised areas in your test/simplesemi/semi-label.bed? How do we know that this semi-supervision produces a desired/correct segmentation? How does it differ from simpleseg? If it's not at all obvious how the semi-supervised .bed regions alters the output perhaps consider changing the supervised training regions. As an example - maybe supervise segway to try to do the opposite of the results from simpleseg?

How does it differ from simpleseg? If it's not at all obvious how the semi-supervised .bed regions alters the output perhaps consider changing the supervised training regions. As an example - maybe supervise segway to try to do the opposite of the results from simpleseg?
